title: What's News --  Business & Finance
text:
Goldman and Morgan Stanley were quick to move large blocks of assets before other large banks that traded with Archegos, as the scale of the hedge fund's losses became apparent. The strategy helped limit the U.S. firms' losses in last week's epic stock liquidation.

---

The number of people seeking bankruptcy fell during the pandemic as government aid propped up income and staved off housing and student-loan obligations.

The Biden administration said a national eviction moratorium would be extended for three months.

---

Southwest Airlines said it is buying 100 new Boeing 737 MAX jets, the largest MAX order since U.S. regulators lifted a flight ban last year.

---

Amazon-backed online food-delivery service Deliveroo said it would price its initial public offering at the lower end of expectations.

---

The S&P 500 retreated from a record, slipping 0.1%, while the Nasdaq fell 0.6%. The Dow rose 0.3%.

---

Online car retailer Cazoo said it would go public through a deal with a blank-check firm that values the combined entity at $8.1 billion.

---

A bidding war has erupted over Cubic, which had agreed to sell itself to two private-equity firms before a new suitor surfaced last week.

---

A Florida investor has expressed interest in joining an effort by a Maryland hotel magnate to acquire Tribune Publishing and wrest it away from hedge fund Alden.
